title: Bharat Ratna Demand For Manmohan Singh Gains Momentum After Telangana Assembly Resolution - News18
summary:
Demand for Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh Grows After Telangana Assembly Resolution

Date: January 01, 2025 | Source: News18

The Telangana Assembly has urged the Central government to confer the Bharat Ratna on former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, prompting many in Congress to support the initiative. Congress leaders are calling for the highest civilian award to honor his significant contributions.

  • Telangana Assembly passes a resolution demanding Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh.
  • Congress Deputy Leader in the Rajya Sabha, Pramod Tiwari, emphasizes the need to acknowledge Singh's leadership.
  • Subharansh Kumar Rai mentions Singh's advocacy for key legislation such as the Right to Education and Right to Information.
  • BJP criticizes Congress for not acting on a previous recommendation to award Singh the Bharat Ratna.
  • Manmohan Singh recently passed away at the age of 92.
“I urge the Centre to accept the resolution. Manmohanji was a great leader of our country and he should be awarded the Bharat Ratna.” - Pramod Tiwari

The push for the Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh highlights his acknowledged role in shaping modern India, suggesting a broader recognition of his legacy may be underway.
newTitle: Demand for Bharat Ratna for Manmohan Singh Grows After Telangana Assembly Resolution

title: Supreme Court Yearly Digest 2024: Family Law [Marriage, Divorce, Child Custody, Alimony & Succession] - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Yearly Digest 2024: Family Law [Marriage, Divorce, Child Custody, Alimony & Succession]

Date & Source: 2024 LiveLaw

This article provides an overview of significant rulings by the Supreme Court in the area of family law, focusing on issues related to child custody, divorce, maintenance, and succession. Key judgements address parental alienation, the welfare of children, and guidelines for determining alimony.

  • Custody disputes should carefully evaluate claims of parental alienation.
  • Minor children's welfare encompasses their physical, educational, and social needs.
  • The right to maintenance should ensure a decent standard of living for spouses post-divorce.
  • New interpretations regarding the legitimacy of children from void marriages and their inheritance rights.
  • There are strict guidelines on how custody and guardianship must be approached in court.
“The interest of the minor child is paramount...” - Supreme Court ruling on visitation rights.

This summary encapsulates the crucial judicial perspectives on family law offered by the Supreme Court, emphasizing children's welfare, equitable treatment in divorce, and the adherence to legal provisions concerning marriage and property rights.
newTitle: Supreme Court Yearly Digest 2024: Family Law Highlights

title: Five family members murdered in Lucknow hotel, accused held - The Indian Express
summary:
Family of Five Found Dead in Lucknow Hotel

Lucknow, India - January 2025 - Five members of a family from Agra were found dead inside a hotel room in Lucknow city’s Naka area on Wednesday, according to the Uttar Pradesh Police.

The deceased include a 49-year-old woman, Asman, and her four daughters – Alishiya (19), Rehmeen (18), Aksha (16), and Aliya (9).

The police have detained Asman’s son, Arshad (24), who reportedly confessed to killing his mother and sisters over a family dispute.

The bodies have been sent for postmortem, and some of the victims had injury marks on their wrists. The police are investigating the cause of death and checking CCTV footage at the hotel.

The police received information about the bodies in the hotel room on Wednesday morning.
newTitle: Family of Five Found Dead in Lucknow Hotel: Mother and Four Daughters Killed by Son

title: Manipur witnesses fresh violence on first day of 2025 in Imphal West - India Today NE
summary:
Manipur witnesses fresh violence on first day of 2025 in Imphal West

Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Living Media India Limited

Violence struck Manipur's Kadangband area on New Year's Day as suspected militants attacked from Kangpokpi district.

  • The attack occurred around 1 am, with militants firing rounds and hurling bombs.
  • Village volunteers returned fire while additional security forces were deployed.
  • Despite the gunfire, no injuries were reported.
  • Many villagers fled their homes seeking safety.
  • This attack marks a continuation of violence in the region since May 2023.
"No injuries were reported in the firing, the police said."

The violence on New Year's Day continues a troubling trend in Manipur, raising concerns over security and safety in the region.
newTitle: Manipur Experiences New Year's Day Violence as Militant Attacks Erupt

CM Biren Singh hits back at Congress' Jairam Ramesh over ‘sorry’ for Manipur unrest, targets former PMs - Hindustan Times
summary:
Biren Singh Responds to Congress on Manipur Unrest and Apology

Date: January 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh criticized Congress leader Jairam Ramesh's remarks regarding Prime Minister Modi's absence in Manipur amidst ongoing unrest.

  • Biren Singh attributes current turmoil in Manipur to Congress's past actions, including the settlement of Burmese refugees.
  • Jairam Ramesh questioned Modi's failure to visit and apologize to the people of Manipur.
  • Biren Singh expressed sincere grief for the victims and called for forgiveness.
  • He mentioned that the Naga-Kuki clashes had resulted in approximately 1,300 deaths and significant displacement.
  • Biren Singh challenged past Prime Ministers on their apologies for historical conflicts in Manipur.
“The apology I extended today was a sincere act of expressing my grief for the people who have been left displaced and became homeless.” - N Biren Singh

The ongoing ethnic clashes in Manipur, which began on May 3, 2023, have led to severe violence and a humanitarian crisis affecting thousands.
newTitle: Biren Singh Responds to Congress on Manipur Unrest and Apology

title: Pushpita Gupta: ‘Nobody we can talk to now in Bangladesh… progressive Muslims have left or are hiding’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Pushpita Gupta: ‘Nobody we can talk to now in Bangladesh… progressive Muslims have left or are hiding’

Date & Source: October 2023, The Indian Express

Pushpita Gupta, a Labour Party Councillor and president of the Secular Bangladesh Movement UK, is currently in India with a delegation to discuss the safety and rights of Hindus in Bangladesh, emphasizing her commitment to advocate for her community amidst rising violence.

  • Gupta has been actively fighting for the rights of Hindus in Bangladesh for over 20 years.
  • She expresses concern over the current safety situation, noting that many progressive Muslims have fled or are hiding due to fear of reprisal.
  • Gupta has raised these issues with UK government officials, including MPs and the Foreign Secretary.
  • The response from UK MPs has been one of shock and concern, with discussions in Parliament about the need for action.
  • She calls for the Indian government to recognize the sacrifices of the Hindu community and take steps to protect them.
  • Gupta criticizes the role of the Bangladesh Army as biased against Hindus.
  • She expresses skepticism about upcoming elections, questioning the legitimacy of the current government.
“My message will be to protect my community, my families, the women in Bangladesh and children — they are suffering.”

In conclusion, Gupta appeals for international support to protect the rights and lives of Hindus in Bangladesh, highlighting the stark reality of fear and violence they face.
newTitle: Pushpita Gupta Addresses Concerns for Hindus in Bangladesh

title: Nimisha Priya case: What option does Kerala nurse on death row in Yemen have? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nimisha Priya case: What option does Kerala nurse on death row in Yemen have?

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Nimisha Priya, a nurse from Kerala, has been sentenced to death in Yemen for the alleged murder of a Yemeni man in 2017. The Indian government is looking to extend assistance for her release.

  • Nimisha Priya was awarded the death sentence in 2020 and her appeal was rejected in November 2023.
  • The Indian Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has expressed commitment to help her family explore options for her release.
  • Negotiations may involve 'blood money' compensation to the victim's family, with significant funds required for this process.
  • The 'Save Nimisha Priya International Action Council' is raising funds for her release.
“It is still possible to hold talks with Mahdi’s family, convince them to pardon Priya possibly in exchange for blood money and secure her release.” - Subhash Chandran KR

The case highlights both the complexities of international law in Yemen and the plight of individuals entangled in foreign legal systems.
newTitle: Nimisha Priya case: What option does Kerala nurse on death row in Yemen have?

summary:

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

Beach shacks in Goa are facing a noticeable decline in tourist footfall, with owners expressing concerns over the lower occupancy rates during this festive season.

  • Despite licenses being issued early, shacks report low occupancy rates.
  • President of the Goa Shack Owners Welfare Society highlights a shift towards cheaper tourist destinations.
  • The government defends Goa's tourism, citing over 80 lakh domestic visitors in 2023.
  • Shack owners suggest more infrastructure improvements to attract higher-spending tourists.
  • Concerns about negative social media perceptions affecting tourism.
“Christmas used to be quite a busy time earlier...though the footfall has increased over the last few days, it is nowhere where it used to be.” - Cruz Cardozo

In conclusion, while there is a slight uptick in visitor numbers, the overall sentiment among shack owners reflects a worrying trend of declining foreign tourist engagement, prompting calls for improved infrastructure and positive repositioning of Goa as a tourist destination.

Date: December 2024

This article uncovers extensive misuse of Aadhaar cards connected to illegal Bangladeshi immigrants in India, revealing various patterns of fraud, police crackdowns, and a growing concern over security and identity verification.

  • Police raids have uncovered fraudulent Aadhaar cards linked to illegal Bangladeshi immigrants across several Indian cities.
  • In response to directives from Delhi's Lieutenant Governor, law enforcement is intensifying verification drives with significant results.
  • Illegal immigration rackets have been exposed, showing systematic procedures to acquire fake identification documents.
  • Notable cases include the aurrests of individuals in Jaipur and Delhi for producing counterfeit Aadhaar cards.
  • Deportations of illegal immigrants are occurring simultaneously with ongoing investigations.
“Under the guidance of @LtGovDelhi, team of @DCPSouthDelhi busted an illegal immigration racket, arresting 5 Bangladeshi Nationals and 6 accused involved in generating Aadhaar cards, voter IDs on the basis of fake birth certificates for Bangladeshi nationals.” - Delhi Police

The ongoing operations highlight increasing vigilance within Indian law enforcement to tackle illegal immigration and associated fraud through systemic verification of identities.

title: New Year 2025: Are banks closed on January 1, 2025? - The Indian Express
summary:
Are Banks Closed on New Year's Day 2025?

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

As we approach the new year, many citizens are curious about banking operations on January 1, 2025 (Wednesday). Understanding bank holiday schedules is crucial for financial planning and managing personal transactions during the festive season.

  • Banks in India are expected to be open on January 1, 2025, as no clear direction from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has been issued yet.
  • Bank holidays vary by state; for example, banks in West Bengal will observe a statewide closure on New Year’s Day.
  • Banks will be open on New Year’s Eve, December 31, 2024, except in Mizoram and Sikkim.
  • Online banking and ATMs will still be available for cash withdrawals during closures.
“Banks across India will be open on New Year’s Eve, December 31, 2024, except for banks in Mizoram and Sikkim.”

It’s essential to check with local bank branches for their specific holiday calendars to be informed about banking operations during the new year.
newTitle: Are Banks Closed on New Year's Day 2025?

Yemen death sentence for Kerala woman: India adopting a cautious route in conflict-hit Sanaa - The Hindu
summary:
India Treads Cautiously on Yemen Death Sentence of Kerala Woman

Published on: December 31, 2024, Source: The Hindu

India is cautiously addressing the sensitive case of Nimisha Priya, a Kerala woman sentenced to death in Yemen for the murder of her Yemeni business partner, amid the complexities of operating in regions controlled by the Houthi faction.

  • Nimisha Priya has been sentenced to death after being convicted of killing her business partner in Yemen.
  • The Yemeni conflict involves multiple factions, complicating the legal and diplomatic situation.
  • India does not have official communication with the Houthis, raising challenges for intervention.
  • Negotiations may be underway for a possible settlement based on Yemeni customs of blood money.
“The government is extending all possible help in the matter,” said Mr. Jaiswal.

This case highlights the intricate intersection of legal processes, international relations, and local conflict in Yemen.
newTitle: India Treads Cautiously on Yemen Death Sentence of Kerala Woman
